backend.src.app.services.auth package

Submodules

backend.src.app.services.auth.current_user_service module

class backend.src.app.services.auth.current_user_service.CurrentUserService(current_user_identity_data)[source]

Bases: object

The CurrentUserService class provides methods for managing the current user.

This class acts as a service for retrieving and preparing data related to the current user.

Variables:

  • current_user_identity_data – The identity data of the current user.

  • employee_repository – An instance of the EmployeeRepository class for interacting with employee data.

  • current_user – An instance of the Employee model representing the current user.

find_current_user_by_identity_data()[source]

Find the current user by their identity data.

This method uses the employee repository to retrieve the current user based on their identity data. The result is stored in the current_user attribute.

prepare_current_user_response()[source]

Prepare a response containing all data about the current user.

This method uses the employee repository to retrieve all data about the current user.

Returns:

A dictionary containing all data about the current user.

Return type:

dict[str, any]

backend.src.app.services.auth.login_service module

class backend.src.app.services.auth.login_service.LoginService(login_data)[source]

Bases: object

The LoginService class provides methods for managing login procedures.

This class acts as a service for validating and preparing data related to login.

Variables:

  • login_data – The login data of the user.

  • employee_repository – An instance of the EmployeeRepository class for interacting with employee data.

  • login_employee – An instance of the Employee model representing the login user.

prepare_login_response()[source]

Prepare a response containing all data about the user.

This method uses the employee repository to retrieve all data about the user, generates JWT access and refresh tokens, sets refresh cookies, and prepares a response.

Returns:

A response containing all data about the employee including access and refresh tokens.

Return type:

flask.Response

validate_user_login_data()[source]

Validate the user login data.

This method uses the employee repository to retrieve the employee based on their login data. The result is stored in the login_employee attribute. The method also checks password hash.

Returns:

True if the login data is valid, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

backend.src.app.services.auth.logout_service module

class backend.src.app.services.auth.logout_service.LogoutService(logout_data)[source]

Bases: object

The LogoutService class provides methods for managing logout procedures.

This class acts as a service for revoking tokens and preparing data related to logout.

Variables:

  • logout_data – The logout data of the user.

  • revoke_token – An instance of the BlacklistToken model representing the token to be revoked.

prepare_logout_response(message)[source]

Prepare a response containing a message and unset JWT cookies.

This method prepares a response with a message indicating successful logout and unsets JWT cookies.

Parameters:

message (dict[str, str]) – A message indicating successful logout.

Returns:

A response containing the message and unset JWT cookies.

Return type:

flask.Response

remove_user_jti_to_blacklist()[source]

Add the token to the blacklist.

This method uses the BlacklistTokensRepository to add the token to the blacklist.

backend.src.app.services.auth.refresh_service module

class backend.src.app.services.auth.refresh_service.RefreshService(refresh_data)[source]

Bases: object

The RefreshService class provides methods for managing JWT refresh procedures.

This class acts as a service for validating and preparing data related to refresh operations.

Variables:

  • refresh_data – The refresh token data of the user.

  • user_identity – The identity of the user extracted from the refresh token.

prepare_refresh_response()[source]

Prepare a response containing the new access token.

This method generates a new JWT access token using the user identity and prepares a response.

Returns:

A dictionary containing the new access token.

Return type:

dict[str, str]

validate_user_refresh_data()[source]

Validate the user refresh token data.

This method uses the JWT decode function to extract the user identity from the refresh token.

Returns:

The identity of the user if the refresh token data is valid, None otherwise.

Return type:

str or None
